titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward Weed letter to Frederic Ayers 1977.409
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:40:38 +0000.

did.unittitle: Edward Weed letter to Frederic Ayers
did.abstract: One letter from Reverend Edward Weed, pastor of the First Free Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn, N.Y., to Reverend Frederic Ayers of Stamford, CT, giving the dates of his visit to Stamford and his probable time of arrival. The letter is dated February 6, 1845.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edward Weed was pastor of the First Free Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Edward Weed letter to Frederic Ayers, 1977.409, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One letter from Reverend Edward Weed to Reverend Frederic Ayers of Stamford, CT, giving the dates of his visit to Stamford and his probable time of arrival. The letter is dated February 6, 1845.
